StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.name: [SaveForm]
StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.body:
( @FormID uniqueiden..er, @TemplatePath varchar(30), @FormName varchar(100), @IsAc.ve bit, @AssemblyName varchar(15), @Data varbinary(max), @FileName varchar(100), @User uniqueiden..er
) AS BEGIN
BEGIN TRANSACTION
IF EXISTS(SELECT FormID FROM [dbo].[Form] WHERE [FormID] = @FormID) BEGIN UPDATE [dbo].[Form] SET [TemplatePath] = @TemplatePath, [FormName] = @FormName, [IsAc.ve] = @IsAc.ve, [AssemblyName] = @AssemblyName, [Data] = @Data, [FileName] = @FileName, [DateUpdated] = GetDate(), [UpdatedUser] = @User
WHERE [FormID] = @FormID END ELSE BEGIN INSERT INTO [dbo].[Form] ( [FormID], [TemplatePath], [FormName], [IsAc.ve], [AssemblyName], [Data], [FileName], [DateUpdated], [UpdatedUser] ) VALUES ( @FormID, @TemplatePath, @FormName, @IsAc.ve, @AssemblyName, @Data, @FileName, GetDate(), @User )
END
-- Rollback the transac.on if there were any errors IF @@ERROR <> 0 BEGIN -- Rollback the transac.on ROLLBACK TRANSACTION
-- Raise an error and return RAISERROR ('Error occurred while performing the change.', 16, 1) RETURN END
-- Rollback the transac.on if the number of rows changed does not meet our expecta.on... IF @@ROWCOUNT > 1 BEGIN -- Rollback the transac.on ROLLBACK TRANSACTION
-- Raise an error and return RAISERROR ('An unexpected number of rows were changed.', 16, 1) RETURN END
-- If we reach this point, the commands completed successfully. COMMIT TRANSACTION END
